unit: Unit 7 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Means
title: Pint Size?
question_text: A verified $95\%$ confidence interval showed that the difference between the weights of two different pints of ice cream brands was $(-0.13, 0.21)$ ounces.  Describe what this confidence interval is saying.

choices.text: We are 95 % 95 % sure that one brand of ice cream weighs 0.21 0.21 ounces more than the other brand.
Based on the samples of ice cream, we can be 95 % 95 % confident that the difference in weights of the pint-sized ice cream brands is between − 0.13 − 0.13 and 0.21 0.21 ounces.
There is a 95 % 95 % probability that one brand of ice cream weighs more than the other one.
We are 95 % 95 % confident that all of the samples taken will have a a difference of means between − 0.13 − 0.13 and 0.21 0.21 ounces.
Based on the samples of ice cream, we can be 90 % 90 % confident that the difference in weights of the pint-sized ice cream brands is between − 0.13 − 0.13 and 0.21 0.21 ounces.
